Extraordinarily detailed dalle de verre windows by ma√Ætre-verrier, Henri Gu√©rin - a 'must-see'
mars 2018 ‚Ä¢ En couple
We are lovers of dalle de verre windows - particularly those by Gabriel Loire (1905-96) - and so were excited to learn of Henri Gu√©rin (1929-2009), another proponent of dalle de verre.

What we had not imagined (perhaps stupidly) was how completely different approaches could be taken to the same medium!

Unlike Loire, Gu√©rin used very small pieces of dalle, almost like slivers or shards of glass set in a cement matrix, and in doing so, was able to convey extraordinary detail in his windows. The amount of work involved in conceiving and realising these windows is simply mind-boggling. The extraordinary detail of these windows can be seen in some of the close-up photos of the windows.

The windows cover the sacraments including: Baptism, Reconciliation, the Eucharist, Holy Orders, Marriage, and Anointing the Sick. There are also windows featuring the Church as a vine, St Etienne and St My (the patrons of the church), a Homage to the Virgin Mary, the Trinitarian Presence, and Pentecost.

For those who love modern church glass, this is a -must-see' sight.
